file_content.text: You can't stop this ritual from happening!
Apprentice! What have you done to me?
Why couldn't you just hold still for a few moments longer? Why couldn't you call your monster off?
I need to learn that ritual.
Wow. Impressive.
What?
I wanted to keep my body.
Sorry.
That monster broke through my defenses, interrupted my concentration, diverted the entire ritual.
Five years of preparation, finding the right person, training them, researching the artifacts, gathering them--wasted.
You were my legacy, my one chance to defeat death! You fool--you've ruined everything!
You shouldn't have opposed me.
No one gets the best of me.
You think you're clever. Well, this beast's body is quite powerful.
Go away and give me Khem back.
I want my Dashade!
No, apprentice. It looks like you're stuck with me now. But I wonder how powerful your friend Khem was.
At least you're not dead.
It could be worse.
No, that's true. And this beast's body makes me quite powerful indeed.
Powerful enough to punish you for your rebellion!
The Dashade is bound to me and now, so are you.
No--you obey me.
I defeated the Dashade once. I can do it again.
You're nothing.
Punish? That's not nice.
What is this? Why can't I hurt you?
That bond, that damn bond. How can your will be stronger than my own? I am the master, not you.
Change is hard, but you'll learn to deal with it.
Cope.
This is what we call a classic reversal of fortune.
Not anymore.
I'm not any happier about it than you are.
You think I like it?
Ha!
What new kink has insinuated itself into the twisted coils of my unfortunate existence?
First Tulak Hord abandons me to this meager creature, and now--it is as if my body is no longer my own.
Wait, you've changed again.
Um, Zash?
I'm just as befuddled as you... whoever you are.
I'm confused.
I am Khem Val, servant of Tulak Hord, who was called Lord of Hate, Master of the Gathering Darkness, Dark Lord of the Sith.
Is that you, my morose monster?
Khem Val?
Last I remember, I was attacking the female Darth when I felt this force, like something trying to drive me from my body.
It was not my Mistress Death, but another. So I resisted the force's pull and then a darkness came over me. Tell me, master. What is going on?
I'm still trying to figure it out myself.
I don't know.
This is crazy.
Think about it, flesh of my flesh.
Zash claimed to have wanted to steal your body for herself. And just now she spoke to you from the Dashade.
It seems Zash went into your body, but you didn't leave.
You and Zash are sharing.
What--no. No!
Protest all you like, Khem Val, servant of Tulak Hord, but your ancient master's artifact has been turned against you.
And through some strange and miraculous trick, neither you nor Zash have full control.
Where were you when everything went sideways a few minutes ago?
Now you decide to show up.
I have been watching from the shadows all along, powerless to help. But it's clear--my help was not necessary.
That sounds pretty complicated... and unlikely.
How does that work?
The Dashade was not part of Zash's plan. Perhaps his innate resistance to the Force impacted things.
Will someone please wake me up when everything's normal again?
This is insane.
The Force is complex, a mystery. There are none who understand it completely. Be content in your victory.
Flesh of my flesh, you have defeated your master. The great danger that I feared is past, your rise to glory complete.
I don't know whether we will chance to meet again on this side of death, but I am at peace. I came to say goodbye, and good luck.
Goodbye.
I guess not everything Zash dreams is a lie, then.
I was supposed to pacify you.
Get out of here.
I'm sick of you.
You are Lord Kallig now. It was once a glorious name. Use it well.
I'm telling you, Corrin, Zash is not all there. All this talk about dreams. It's nonsense.
No, Kaal. I saw Zash enter, and we both saw her first apprentice go in later.
If I went around expecting everything I dreamt to come true, I--
Look, Kaal.
Darth Zash! You--you murdered her!
I'll finish you off just as easily.
And?
Actually, no, Khem did.
I blame the monster.
She did try to steal my life, after all.
She started it.
Hold your weapon, Kaal. This is not what Zash wanted.
My lord--we have not met, but Kaal and I are Zash's newest apprentices.
She honored us by telling us about a prophecy, a dream she had... one that has now been fulfilled by you.
Oh, I know all about her dreams.
Zash and her dreams.
Go on.
Yay me.
Darth Zash dreamt that her strongest apprentice would eventually rise to destroy her.
But she also foresaw that the same apprentice would rise to bring new glory and strength to a fragmented Sith Order.
She went knowingly to her death at your hand so that you could lead the Sith to glory!
Zash was weak, and I crushed her easily.
She wasn't strong enough.
As she knew you would.
Believe me, Zash only thought of herself.
She's not that selfless.
How strange; Darth Zash only ever had words of praise for you.
We have been anticipating this day since Zash first leaked the rumors of your incredible triumph over Darth Skotia.
Zash answered to Darth Thanaton on the Dark Council--he'll want to speak to you. But we are your servants.
I really must remember to thank Zash for this.
Zash did something right.
Zash is the past. You are now.
I will see this Thanaton--and then our work can begin.
Excellent.
Yes, my lord.
Now what are the rest of you staring at? Bow to your new master!
Khem, will you do the honors?
Announce me, monster.
Gladly, my master.
Behold, the heir of Kallig, slayer of Zash, successor of Tulak Hord, Lord of the Sith. Now, bow!
I said to bring the Dashade. The bond between master and servant is delicate. I would not dare begin the ritual without him.
Such marvelous power radiates from you now. Clear. Strong. You have truly come into your own.
You possess great power, certainly, but the teachings of Korriban seem to have had scant influence on you.
How many times did you have the option to expand your power and yet stayed your hand? Do you really know what it means to be Sith?
Like the Sith Code says, my chains are broken. I can choose my own path.
It means freedom.
Indeed it does. But what worth is that freedom if you don't use it?
A Sith follows his heart.
I do what I feel.
A Sith follows her heart.
I do what I feel.
Yes, "there is only passion." But do not forget--"through passion I gain strength; through strength, power." Passion is the method; power the end.
I thought it unwise to make unnecessary enemies.
I was just using caution.
I hope that is the case, and not a lack of ambition that restrains you.
I've arranged for you to receive the title of Lord of the Sith. I hope you realize what an honor and responsibility it is.
As a Darth, I answer only to Darth Thanaton who answers to the Dark Council. As a lord, you're only one step below that, and you tower above many.
The power is mine!
Yes!
I hope I live up to the honor.
I will do my best.
You've already exceeded my greatest hopes and expectations. But I'm getting ahead of myself.
It's about time greatness got its due.
Finally.
Do not get ahead of yourself, apprentice.
There is still the ritual to undergo. And I'll warn you--the ritual may prove a trying experience.
But once it's done, you will be truly great, truly powerful.
If by powerful, you mean dead.
I don't believe you.
Apprentice! Where did you get an idea like that? When have I ever tried to do you harm?
You still haven't told me what the ritual does.
I hate being in the dark.
All in good time, apprentice. First, there is something more pressing.
Let's hurry.
Yes, I am eager as well, but there is something I must tell you.
The truth is, I have not been completely honest with you. I wish I could have been, but the timing was not right.
Look at me, apprentice. I am sorry to have concealed it from you for so long--but it was such a pleasant vanity to share in your youth.
Why are you showing me this now?
I don't understand.
You make Rodians look kissable.
Wow. Ugly.
I'm glad I could help.
Listen, apprentice. Various Force rituals have helped me maintain my appearance and some of my vitality.
But inevitably, life fades. I'm dying, apprentice. My will, my intellect, my spirit are as lively as ever, but this body is dying.
Too bad you can't just order a new one.
I guess you only get one.
But apprentice, that's exactly what I've done.
Enough about you.
Everything. You will be my second chance, my new life.
Can I help?
You've already done more than you realize, apprentice. You will allow me to live on.
Be prepared. As the ritual ends, you will likely see me collapse before you feel it taking effect.
Do not panic. Know that this is what I have trained you for, primed you for, from the start.
And what exactly is that?
Be more specific.
I thought it was apparent. My body is dying, and yours is brand new.
This isn't good.
Don't worry. I imagine it will be just like falling asleep.
The sooner we finish this, the better.
Then let's get started.
Ever eager. And here I thought you might be less than willing.
Ah, we will accomplish so much once I am in command of that wonderful vessel of yours. Just hold still.
Apprentice! You've arrived on Dromund Kaas. Marvelous. Let's get right to work.
Secrecy is vital, so I've secured us a nice, out-of-the-way spot for the ritual.
Meet me in the innermost chamber of the Dark Temple, where you pacified the apparition, and we can begin.
It's time you told me what this ritual entails.
I need more information.
I will, apprentice. But not here, not now. Come to the Dark Temple and I will share all, in private.
I trust you've made all the necessary preparations.
Are you ready?
Indeed. All I need are the artifacts themselves and, of course, you. Then we can begin.
If you make one move against me, I'll strike.
No funny business.
My dear apprentice. From the very beginning, everything I have done, I've done for you.
But there is one thing: Given the sensitive nature of this ritual, I would ask that you not bring your pirate companion.
Your Dashade is fine--desirable even--given the sensitive nature of your bond to him.
I have no use for the pirate anyway.
Andronikos is worthless.
That makes things simple, then.
Yes, I think you ought to bring the Dashade.
I won't go into detail here, but the bond between master and servant is more delicate than you may think.
It would be best for the Dashade to be present, to ensure the ritual does not break your bond.
I will obey, master.
As you say.
But the monster attracts so much attention.
He's just so... unsubtle.
It is only for the ritual, apprentice. I do not wish to see you lose such a valuable asset.
I guess it is time for Khem's walk.
He does need to get out.
Good.
Yes.
It looks like you'll have to wait in the wings, friend.
Sorry, Andronikos.
I understand. But if you ask me, this stinks clear to Dagobah.
You think everything stinks clear to Dagobah.
You're just paranoid.
Why?
You've seen me in action--I can handle myself.
Don't worry about me.
I helped you find that artifact on Tatooine. Don't know why it's such a secret I can't come with you.
Don't belabor the point, apprentice. You must trust that my reasons are sufficient.
As long as I can bring my lightsaber.
Do I at least get a weapon?
I don't see why not. Though I can't imagine you'll have to use it.
Now, hurry and meet me in the Dark Temple. The sooner you arrive, the sooner we can begin.
Apprentice. You have all the artifacts. Excellent. Meet me on Dromund Kaas. Immediately.
I'm sorry I don't have more time to talk. There is much work to do to prepare the ritual.
Look at her. "No time to talk." Too busy plotting your demise. Cruel witch.
You have done well, flesh of my flesh, in seeking out your inheritance. But things are more dire than I suspected.
I have discovered the nature of Darth Zash's strange rituals. There is no doubt that she intends to cause you harm.
Tell me about these rituals.
Rituals?
I'll believe it when I see it. Not before.
I trust Zash.
Then you would throw everything away.
I knew it was too good to last.
It was inevitable.
Yes. Her words smell of honey and taste of poison.
Zash praises your great strength--yet she fears it. The rituals she performs are to protect her against the Force.
Ask yourself: Why go to such lengths to defend herself against the Force, if she has no intention of fighting you?
I'm sure she has a very good motive.
There are other reasons.
The time for defending Zash has passed. If you wish to live, you will do as I say.
What do I do?
I'm not afraid of Zash.
She doesn't scare me.
Do not let Zash move first. Arm yourself with anger, steel yourself with hate. Crush her before she has a chance to strike.
And if at all possible, do not face her alone, but bring an ally who can break through her defenses.
Zash won't know what hit her, isn't that right, Andronikos?
My pirate friend will help.
Zash did me a good turn, letting me out of Imperial prison. I'm not sure I like the idea of repaying her like this.
But you did me a couple good turns yourself on Tatooine, and I said I'd follow your lead.
Khem Val lives to devour Force users, isn't that right?
I have a Dashade at my side.
It is my greatest need, after service to death and my master.
Zash won't know what hit her.
I'll crush her.
Of course.
Good.
I still can't believe Zash would hurt me.
This is too strange.
She has seduced you with the illusion of freedom, so that you may die her willing slave.
I can be no further help to you. I am too weak to face Zash. It depends on you.
Just remember, whatever you do, do not enter the Dark Temple alone. Zash is prepared.
You're looking for Zash? Well, she's not here. Allow me to introduce myself. Darth Thanaton.
Don't worry, I haven't done anything to your master. I'm far too interested in how this game she's playing will turn out.
I've waited a long time to meet you. An alien in the Sith ranks is an extremely rare thing.
I've waited a long time to meet you. Your rise from the slave pens has been non-traditional to say the least.
I'm never going to hear the end of that, am I?
You think I'm unworthy.
No, you won't. Not until you convince your naysayers of your worth.
It never ceases to amaze me how narrow-minded the Sith can be.
Why are the Sith such snobs?
I wouldn't call it narrow-mindedness. The individual and the social will must be reconciled. There are no lords in an anarchy.
Is there a problem with where I came from?
Do you object?
Others have risen from slavery to do great things.
I'm not concerned with your origins. The trials on Korriban are an honored tradition designed to sift out the unworthy. I trust they've served their purpose.
I want to speak to you about your master.
You don't like her very much, do you?
I take it you're not a fan.
Are you still angry about the Skotia incident?
She didn't kill the cyborg?
The "Skotia incident" is the least of my concerns or your master's transgressions.
That seems to be everyone's favorite subject these days.
I'd rather you talk about me.
Really. I'd love to hear what "everyone" has to say.
Darth Zash is arrogant and reckless. The reckless have a way of defeating themselves in the end.
When she finally self-destructs, be careful not to get caught in the blast. A young Sith should not associate herself too closely with a master like Zash.
When she finally self-destructs, be careful not to get caught in the blast. A young Sith should not associate himself too closely with a master like Zash.
A young Sith can't get very far without a powerful master.
What do you suggest I do?
You should've warned me sooner.
It's too late for that.
For your sake, I hope it is not.
It's alright. I'm going to kill her anyway.
She's as good as dead.
I will pretend I didn't hear that.
You must seek your own way, carve out your own victories. The cult you won on Nar Shaddaa was a good first step, but it's not enough.
A Sith cannot live without a power base. Good luck.
My child. Your power has grown since we last met. Your strength will rise and shake the Sith. I feel it!
Now I have another gift for you--one that was dearer to me than even my life.
My own lightsaber. Until now, lost to me... but through your great power in the Force, I have found it. You must claim it.
So where do I find this lightsaber?
Tell me where to look.
You know, it's not really a gift if I have to get it myself.
Wait--there's work involved?
I already have a lightsaber, fool.
Blah blah blah.
Ah, but not one like this. No, you have never wielded a weapon like this.
I entrusted it to my faithful retainer, Jonas Escalus, the only servant who didn't betray me when Tulak Hord moved against me.
He swore he and his heirs would keep it safe until the time that my heir would return to claim it.
His heir is on Nar Shaddaa, working in one of the casinos there. Her name is Mila Escalus. Go to her and claim your inheritance.
Tell me, have you recovered my mask from Korriban? Are you prepared to face your master?
My master will not betray me.
I trust Zash.
Foolishness! Our bloodline will be destroyed by your naivete!
I'll get around to it eventually.
Give me time.
Do not delay too long. I assure you, Darth Zash does not rest!
I was born ready.
I don't need to prepare.
You were born naked and weak!
If you have not gone to Korriban to recover the piece of my armor, you must do so. Your life and our glory depends on it.
Yes!
Good. Keep that treasure with you always.
Ah, apprentice. You have the artifact. Wonderful!
And Lady Thul sends her thanks once more for your aid against Organa's Jedi.
I only did it for the prize.
She really shouldn't.
I don't know that I've ever met a nicer person.
She's so kind.
She knows who her friends are--as do you, apparently.
It was delightful.
And won an important victory.
Lady Thul is a vital ally to the Empire. By all accounts, you have a very promising future ahead of you, apprentice.
Apprentice. You have a lot of nerve even coming back to this ship!
Answer me this: Are you insane or just incredibly stupid? How could you not help Lady Elana Thul?
A Sith bows to no one.
It was beneath me.
You are lucky I am not present in the flesh, apprentice--or you would bow to me.
My apologies.
Sorry? Do you think "sorry" will bring back Elana Thul, or repair your muddied reputation?
I was busy chasing down your artifact.
I had other things to do.
You fool. The artifacts have kept for hundreds of years! You let Elana Thul die.
I'm sorry. Emotion should be channeled into real power, not wasted on senseless rages.
You did well to secure the artifact, apprentice, but there are gaps in your education.
Teach me now, master.
I'm listening.
Why does that noble's death bother you so much?
I don't see the problem.
It's not Lady Thul's death that bothers me. It's your seeming lack of concern for your reputation.
I don't need any lessons from you.
You're a fool.
If I were you, I'd watch my tongue.
Your growth has been phenomenal. But with great power comes much unwanted attention.
I will not always be around to protect you from your critics, apprentice. And they will not all meet you face-to-face.
I will take your advice to heart.
Fine.
That is all I ask.
Is there something you're not telling me?
You're acting strange.
No. It is only the way of the Sith. No one lives long.
I don't need your protection.
I can take care of myself.
Suit yourself, apprentice.
Now that you've found the last of the artifacts, I hope to see you on Dromund Kaas as soon as possible. We still have much work to do.
Find the other artifacts, and meet me on Dromund Kaas as soon as possible!
Apprentice! You have recovered the artifact I take it? Wonderful.
Ah, Andronikos. What a pleasure to see you again.
Hello yourself. Looks like you finally found your rock.
Yes, thank you for leading us to it, so obligingly. I'm sure you'll be a wonderful asset to my apprentice's crew.
Now, apprentice, you must hurry to Dromund Kaas. Now that you have all the artifacts, we must prepare the ritual!
Now, apprentice. You must hurry and recover the remaining artifact.
As you say.
This should be fun.
I hope you like having your own personal slave.
If I must.
This is for you apprentice. I am the fading sunset to your bright morning star.
I look forward to seeing you in your glory.
Apprentice! I know you are very busy, but I must speak with you.
I have just had the most amazing dream, and it concerns you.
I've discovered where the last two artifacts are hidden--on Tatooine and Alderaan. I can give you more details when you reach the planets themselves.
But also, I have just had the most amazing dream, and it concerns you.
You owe me an explanation.
I'm unhappy with you.
You sound unhappy, apprentice. Have I done something to anger you?
I want to know what this artifact does.
Tell me about this artifact.
I've told you as much as I know, except that I'm more certain than ever that you are meant to have it.
You've taken other apprentices.
I'm jealous.
I just wanted to chat.
Not really.
Well, then. Excellent.
Don't you have other apprentices to talk to?
Why me?
Apprentice, I'm sorry. The Dark Council required that I take more apprentices as a sort of--punishment--for my suspected involvement in Skotia's death.
I should have told you myself, but believe me, these others are nothing compared to you.
As long as we're clear on that.
Okay.
You are irreplaceable, apprentice.
If they get in my way, I'll crush them.
They'd better not interfere.
I would not let anyone get in your way.
So what did you want to talk about?
Let's change the subject.
As I said, I just had the most marvelous dream--much like the one in which you pacified the apparition in the Dark Temple.
Can't get me out of your head, can you?
Always thinking about me.
In the dream, I could see the power of the Force coursing through you.
Armies of Jedi rose in your path and fell before you. It's the artifact! It must be! The artifact will give you this power.
Guess I'd better finish getting the artifacts, then.
I have work to do.
Really?
Are you sure it wasn't just something you ate?
Dreams don't mean anything.
Only certain individuals, it seems, are properly attuned to the ritual the artifacts describe.
I believe the remaining artifacts are on Tatooine and Alderaan. You must hurry and find them.
I will inform you when I learn the location of the other two artifacts. In the meantime, you must continue your search.
The artifacts are the key to fulfilling your destiny.
Flesh of my flesh. Listen to me.
I cannot linger long. It takes too much out of me to appear here. But I must warn you.
Your master, Darth Zash, is plotting something. Whatever it is can mean nothing good for you.
Zash would never hurt me.
No, she wouldn't do that.
You are naive.
Wait--which one are you again?
I don't remember you.
I am your ancestor, Kallig, whose nightmare you ended when you first began your rise to power.
I killed Skotia. I'm not afraid of Zash.
I'm unstoppable.
Do not become arrogant.
I have seen Zash making her preparations.
She's taken two new apprentices, a boy named Kaal and a girl named Corrin. She's been sending them into the Dark Temple--presumably to confirm that I am gone.
I hope you killed them.
They're dead now, right?
Zash has other apprentices?
What? Apprentices?
Yes. I assume they are meant to replace you.
A few apprentices in a tomb does not an evil scheme make.
You're overreacting.
I was confident, too, before my own death. You are Sith. You must suspect everything.
I considered killing these intruders, but I heard them speak of Zash and her desire that the chamber be secure for her work.
Soon enough, Zash herself appeared. She comes every day now, studying the place and performing rituals. You are in danger.
What kind of rituals?
Rituals?
Minor ones. Preparations for something bigger.
Zash's job is to study the Dark Temple.
It's her duty.
And have you forgotten how hard she worked to get that job? To see Skotia dead?
I appreciate it.
Zash has taught you, crafted you to be everything she needs you to be.
Zash knows your weaknesses. You must prepare yourself. An enterprising Sith Lord on Korriban has uncovered a piece of my old armor, my mask.
It will protect you against Zash's onslaught. The Sith Lord's compound overlooks the tombs. Go. Claim it. Guard yourself against Zash's attack.
I trust you will let me know if anything else develops.
Keep me informed.
As you say.
I cannot guarantee when I will be able to speak with you again. As I said, it is difficult for me to visit you.
I told you. Zash isn't going to kill me.
I won't need it.
You're a fool! And I haven't the strength to stay and make you see.
But I will continue to watch over my chamber in the temple, conserving my energy for when I learn something more.
I've found the artifact.
Excellent. I trust Major Bessiker was a good help.
I've traced another artifact to Nar Shaddaa, but I'm still trying to locate the other two.
I'll see what I can learn while you're on Nar Shaddaa. Now, hurry. There can be no gain without haste.
I managed to obtain the artifact from Lord Paladius.
And you gained your own cult in the process, or so I hear. You are quickly becoming quite the cunning Sith.
But there's still the artifact on Balmorra to pursue. I'm still trying to locate the other two.
I feel I'm close. I fully expect to have good news when you return from Balmorra. But there is no time to rest. Power does not favor the slow.
You've lost me.
